document_data.mainbody:
'''Northwest Faerûn''', generally referred to as '''the North''' or even '''the Savage North''',

The inhabitants of areas further south, in [[West Faerûn]], described this area in condescension as "the Savage North," which was a reference to the [[Savage Frontier]] and a time when its inhabitants were less civilized.

{{Quote|''So as you shiver in the cold and the dark,''
''Look into the fire and see in its spark—''

''My eye''
''Watching over you.''|The opening stanza of a time-honored Northern trail song.}}
{{TOC limit|3}}

Geography.Flora & Fauna: The woodlands of the North were primarily made up of broad-leafed deciduous trees, such as [[birch]]es, [[elm]]s, [[maple]]s, and [[oak]]s. In the northernmost reaches of the region, these deciduous trees gave way to coniferous ones, such as [[larch]]es, ponderosa [[pine]]s, [[spruce]]s, [[tamarack]]s, and white pines.
Geography.Geographical Features:
[[File:NorthwestFaerun-Map HighRes.jpg|thumb|right|300px|''Northwest Faerûn ''circa'' 1489 DR.'']]
Just as defining the North proved difficult, attempts to divide it into smaller and more distinct regions were, in themselves, often inconsistent. The well-traveled and all-too-famous Volothamp, in the aforementioned guide, himself split it into a set of five: The [[Dessarin Valley]], along the matching [[River Dessarin]]; the [[Sword Coast North|Sword Coast]] upwards of Waterdeep; the [[Frozenfar]]; and the rest, the Interior, making up the area surrounding Silverymoon and fellow [[Sundabar]]. Given the purposes of his work, Volo chose to exclude the [[High Forest]] from his categorization, though acknowledged that its size alone made it a worthy candidate.
